text:
Svidrigaïlov sighed. 

“Marfa Petrovna was a jealous woman,” he said. 

He paused, remembering. 

“She thought I was a profligate. No real love in me. 

But she was tender. When we quarreled, I stayed silent. 

It pleased her. She was proud of me then. 

Yet, she couldn’t stand your sister. 

Why did she hire such a beautiful governess? 

Marfa Petrovna fell in love with her. 

It was madness.” 

He shook his head, lost in thought.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marfa Petrovna, despite her sensible nature, was deeply affected by jealousy and love, particularly towards Avdotya Romanovna, complicating her relationship with Svidrigaïlov.
